name: Trivial Conjecture
statement: $$$$$$f(n) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \frac{n}{2} & n \equiv 0 \pmod{2}\\ 3n+1 & n \equiv 1 \pmod{2}\\ \end{array} \right.$$$$$$ Find an integer $$$n$$$ so that none of the first $$$k$$$ terms of the sequence $$$n, f(n), f(f(n)), f(f(f(n))), \dots$$$ are equal to $$$1$$$.
inputFormat: The only line contains an integer $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \leq k \leq \min(\textbf{[REDACTED]}, 10^{18})$$$).
outputFormat: Output a single integer $$$n$$$ such that none of the first $$$k$$$ terms of the sequence $$$n, f(n), f(f(n)), f(f(f(n))), \dots$$$ are equal to $$$1$$$. Integer $$$n$$$ should have at most $$$10^3$$$ digits.
